posts.post_content:
I just finished reading the fabulous book called "Fifty Nine in 84'". Story of Charles Radbourn's incredible season with the Providence Grays.
One of the better baseball books I've ever read and the spark for my recent interest in Old Judge N172's.

I've decided that a fun way to subdivide my interest in the set and focus my efforts would be to collect players from the Championship 1884 Grays squad.

The Providence Grays ceased to exist after the 1885 season so all of the players still active in the Major Leagues in 1887 would be featured with other teams on any available Old Judge card . 
I would be interested in buying or trading for any of the following:

1884 Providence Grays

CBarney Gilligan
1BJoe Start
2BJack Farrell
SSArthur Irwin
3BJerry Denny
OFPaul Hines
OFPaul Radford
OFCliff Carroll
CSandy Nava
iFCharlie Bassett
UTMiah Murray
OFCyclone Miller
OFJohn Cattanach

POld Hoss Charles Radbourn
PCharlie Sweeney
PEd Conley
PHarry Arundel

Mgr.Frank Bancroft

Not sure if all of these players actually have OJ's but will set about doing the research while I begin the search for cards.
I welcome your help.
RayB

Still on the hunt for N172 Grays.
Friendly bump.
RayB

Ray-I just noticed your post. I'll see if I can help. Send me an email at [url]oldjudge@gmail.com[/url] and I'll send back scans of any I have.

Best---Jay
